intro: Fagara nannophylla, commonly known as the small-leaf fagara, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically small and elliptical in shape. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, woody fruits. Fagara nannophylla is often found in humid, shaded environments such as tropical forests.
